column4: so... I'm looking to "break into" the linux world (this is my first time on IRC even).  Kinda tired of being locked into M$ developer role... is Ubuntu a good place to start?
I know you're biased... I'm hoping for a bit of honesty and some help
I think Ubuntu is the right choice for me, just not sure if it's the right starting choice
Ubuntu is a really good place for newbies to start because you can't really hurt yourself with gnome, and because the community is so helpful.
Java is cross-platform. No problems with that.
Gaming is a huge problem. There's a couple simple games for Linux available. Wine will also run a few windows games. But for the most part you're better off dual-booting or having a gaming box.
thanx.  well, I like to game... but I guess it's not really my top priority
Unix? Is that that expensive thing they had in the '80s?
yep, and at my college... so much not fun to go from that to a job that says "oh, you know MFC, right?"
No. The UI is handled by toolkit libraries: the main ones are gtk and qt, and those are available on all modern distros and even on windows.

Where you get into problems is the different libraries. Often the versions of the libraries are different between distros and they change with time since there's nothing like in windows where they have to keep exact compatibilty or corporate vendors will yell at them.
That's why a lot of software on Linux is either distributed from source or downloaded directly from the distro repositories.
so I would be better off knowing which distro(s) I could be developing for?
So you would be better off writing open source. :)
What are you laughing at?
how far this all is from what I *thought* I knew...

It was really tough when I switched to Linux and I had no idea how to even give a file path. I had no idea how the filesystem syntax worked. I had to learn to use the command line even though I'd never even seen it before!
But I figured it out and I'd never go back now :)
That's actually really comforting. I know I'll still need a Windows box for some of my work, but it's really quite intimidating.
Just keep trying and ask over here if you need help :) you'll get it in no time.
thanks
